body_html:
text_classification.txt

We are using TF 1.3.0 and text_classification.py uses tf.estimator but we still face that issue.
You can reproduce the issue by running the attached code (convert .txt to .py).

To train without testing use (no error):
SP_TRAIN1=1
SP_TRAIN=1
SP_TEST=0

To test without training use (you will get the error in this case):
SP_TRAIN1=0
SP_TRAIN=0
SP_TEST=1

To test without training but uncomment training input function, use (you will NOT get the error in this case):
SP_TRAIN1=1
SP_TRAIN=0
SP_TEST=1
body_text:
text_classification.txt
We are using TF 1.3.0 and  text_classification.py  uses tf.estimator but we still face that issue.
You can reproduce the issue by running the attached code (convert .txt to .py).
To train without testing use (no error):
SP_TRAIN1=1
SP_TRAIN=1
SP_TEST=0
To test without training use (you will get the error in this case):
SP_TRAIN1=0
SP_TRAIN=0
SP_TEST=1
To test without training but uncomment training input function, use (you will NOT get the error in this case):
SP_TRAIN1=1
SP_TRAIN=0
SP_TEST=1
body:
[text_classification.txt](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/files/1421562/text_classification.txt)


We are using TF 1.3.0 and  [text_classification.py]([url](url))  uses tf.estimator but we still face that issue.
You can reproduce the issue by running the attached code (convert .txt to .py).


To train without testing use (no error):
SP_TRAIN1=1
SP_TRAIN=1
SP_TEST=0

To test without training use (you will get the error in this case):
SP_TRAIN1=0
SP_TRAIN=0
SP_TEST=1

To test without training but uncomment training input function, use (you will NOT get the error in this case):
SP_TRAIN1=1
SP_TRAIN=0
SP_TEST=1
